p:
The impacts of five different factors on changes in Australia’s CO2 emissions are summarized in Fig. 12. Looking at the aggregated impacts of these factors, it is possible to conclude that the trend of CO2 emissions increased at a rate of 5134 ktons (kilotons) CO2 per year, on average. It is clear that one of the main key drivers of the changes in CO2 emissions was the real income effect in the reviewed period.Fig. 12
LMDI decomposition analysis results of Australia over 1990–2017
